definition: to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross

sentences.english: To this day, countless cover versions of the song are played in clubs and at parties.
sentences.chinese: 到今天，俱乐部和派对上放过不计其数的翻唱版。

sentences.english: We also did some Beatles covers and got to be kind of psychedelic.
sentences.chinese: 我们也做披头士的翻唱而那有点迷幻。

sentences.english: It was John Cale's, from his album I'm Your Fan.
sentences.chinese: 凯尔在专辑《我是你的歌迷》中的翻唱。

sentences.english: When I play it for EM, they just say it's wack.
sentences.chinese: 当我开口翻唱阿姆的这首歌时，他们只说这真怪。

sentences.english: Several groups have even done modern renditions of old hymns.
sentences.chinese: 许多乐队甚至翻唱了老赞美诗的现代版。

sentences.english: Mando- pop remakes of Western songs sound better than the originals.
sentences.chinese: 西洋歌曲的中文翻唱版比原曲好听。

definition: sung performance/to sing for an audience
album/record (music)/special collection of printed or broadcast material
Fish Leong (1978-), Malaysian pop singer/also Leong Chui Peng or Jasmine Leong
